description: This trap alerts of major problems in the device.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceSystemTrap RAD-MIB::atmNteEventType i 3 RAD-MIB::agnLed s EXAMPLE RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3

description: This parameter identifies the event.
On - the problem exist.
Off - the problem not exist.
InvalidLogin - Invalid login on local console.
CorrectLogin - Successful login operation.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::atmNteEventType

description: This entry specifies the LEDs status of the agent module . Each led will be represented by 4
bits where the first 2 bits (left) will specify the status :
(00=NA, 01=OFF, 10=ON, 11=BLINK)
and the next two bits (right) will specify the color :
(00=GREEN, 01=RED, 10=YELLOW, 11=GRAY)
variables.name: RAD-MIB::agnLed

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This trap is sent upon starting or stopping Alarm
Forwarding Mechanism.

Summary.eval: ($v2==3) ? 'Alarm forwarding mechanism stopped' : 'Alarm forwarding mechanism started'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceAlarmForwardingTrap RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This trap indicates Loss Of Signal.

Summary.eval: ($v2==2) ? 'Loss of signal resolved' : 'Loss of signal detected'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceAlarmLOS RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This object is an 'alias' name for the interface as
specified by a network manager, and provides a non-volatile
'handle' for the interface.
On the first instantiation of an interface, the value of
ifAlias associated with that interface is the zero-length
string. As and when a value is written into an instance of
ifAlias through a network management set operation, then the
agent must retain the supplied value in the ifAlias instance
associated with the same interface for as long as that
interface remains instantiated, including across all re-
initializations/reboots of the network management system
including those which result in a change of the interface's
ifIndex value.
An example of the value which a network manager might store
in this object for a WAN interface is the (Telco's) circuit
number/identifier of the interface.
Some agents may support write-access only for interfaces
having particular values of ifType. An agent which supports
write access to this object is required to keep the value in
non-volatile storage, but it may limit the length of new
values depending on how much storage is already occupied by
the current values for other interfaces.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: This trap indicates Loss Of Frame.

Summary.eval: ($v2==2) ? 'Loss of frame resolved' : 'Loss of frame detected'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceAlarmLOF RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This object is an 'alias' name for the interface as
specified by a network manager, and provides a non-volatile
'handle' for the interface.
On the first instantiation of an interface, the value of
ifAlias associated with that interface is the zero-length
string. As and when a value is written into an instance of
ifAlias through a network management set operation, then the
agent must retain the supplied value in the ifAlias instance
associated with the same interface for as long as that
interface remains instantiated, including across all re-
initializations/reboots of the network management system
including those which result in a change of the interface's
ifIndex value.
An example of the value which a network manager might store
in this object for a WAN interface is the (Telco's) circuit
number/identifier of the interface.
Some agents may support write-access only for interfaces
having particular values of ifType. An agent which supports
write access to this object is required to keep the value in
non-volatile storage, but it may limit the length of new
values depending on how much storage is already occupied by
the current values for other interfaces.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: This trap is sent upon UAS start or end per port.

Summary.eval: ($v2==3) ? 'UAS start per port' : 'UAS end per port'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceAlarmUAS RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: This trap is sent upon atmNteAlarmType start or end
for a cluster of VPs/VCs (according to atmNteLevel) with
the same alarm on the same physical port.
This trap replaces sending the same alarm for a big
quantity (the quantity described in the product
specification document) of VPs/VCs in order to prevent
flooding the NMS and the network with traps.

Summary.eval: ($v2==2) ? '$v3 end for cluster of $v4' : '$v3 start for cluster of $v4'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceAlarmCluster RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 RAD-MIB::atmNteAlarmType i 1 RAD-MIB::atmNteLevel i 2

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This object specifies the type of the alarm.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::atmNteAlarmType

description: This object specifies the ATM level.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::atmNteLevel

description: This trap is sent upon HW failure per port.

Summary.eval: ($v2==2) ? 'HW failure per port cleared' : 'HW failure per port detected'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceHwFailure RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE

variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

specified by a network manager, and provides a non-volatile
'handle' for the interface.

variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: This trap is sent when Bandwidth allocation is > max possible
value for the installed card.
For ACE2002 this trap will be sent for the following cases:
Card insertion - if the total Input and/or Output Bandwidth is over
allocated, then the specific card rate will be set to 0 and this trap
will be sent with the Input/Output rates values.
Upgrade from former version - when an over allocated Bandwidth is detected,
this trap will be sent with atmConfIfInputRate=atmConfIfOutputRate=0xFFFFFFFF.

event.Summary: Bandwidth allocation is greater than max possible value for the installed card

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceUnavailableBwTrap RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE RAD-MIB::atmConfIfInputRate i 9999 RAD-MIB::atmConfIfOutputRate i 9999

supported per port. Successfully setting this parameter
is dependent on all other ports values calculations,
which are described in the NMS SRS.

supported per port. Successfully setting this parameter
is dependent on all other ports values calculations,
which are described in the NMS SRS.

description: This trap indicates Misinserted Cells on a VC Connection reported
by PM.

Summary.eval: ($v2==2) ? 'Misinserted cells resolved on VC connection' : 'Misinserted cells on VC connection detected'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceAlarmVcMisinsertedCells RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

description: This object is an 'alias' name for the interface as
specified by a network manager, and provides a non-volatile
'handle' for the interface.
On the first instantiation of an interface, the value of
ifAlias associated with that interface is the zero-length
string. As and when a value is written into an instance of
ifAlias through a network management set operation, then the
agent must retain the supplied value in the ifAlias instance
associated with the same interface for as long as that
interface remains instantiated, including across all re-
initializations/reboots of the network management system
including those which result in a change of the interface's
ifIndex value.
An example of the value which a network manager might store
in this object for a WAN interface is the (Telco's) circuit
number/identifier of the interface.
Some agents may support write-access only for interfaces
having particular values of ifType. An agent which supports
write access to this object is required to keep the value in
non-volatile storage, but it may limit the length of new
values depending on how much storage is already occupied by
the current values for other interfaces.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: This trap indicates an unexpected cell from user or network port.

Summary.eval: ($v2==2) ? 'Expected cell detected from user or network port' : 'Unexpected cell detected from user or network port'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceAlarmVcUnexpectedCell RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE

description: This object specifies the severity of the alarms.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity

variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: This trap is sent upon UAS start or end per VC.

Summary.eval: ($v2==3) ? 'UAS start per VC' : 'UAS end per VC'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceAlarmVcUAS RAD-MIB::alarmSeverity i 3 RAD-MIB::alarmState i 2 IF-MIB::ifAlias s EXAMPLE

description: This trap is sent upon OAM LoopBack fail status per VC.

variables.name: IF-MIB::ifAlias

description: The trap is sent every time there is a change in
the state of one of the LEDs.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceStatusChange RAD-MIB::agnLed s EXAMPLE RAD-MIB::agnIndication i 1

description: This entry specifies the LEDs status of the agent module . Each led will be represented by 4
bits where the first 2 bits (left) will specify the status :
(00=NA, 01=OFF, 10=ON, 11=BLINK)
and the next two bits (right) will specify the color :
(00=GREEN, 01=RED, 10=YELLOW, 11=GRAY)
variables.name: RAD-MIB::agnLed

description: Attribute describing the state of the entity the agent is responsible for.
In case of a modular entity, the value of this attribute will be according
to the component which is in the worst state.
The order of severity (from top to bottom) is:
critical-> major (or faulty)-> minor-> event-> warning-> normal (off).
variables.name: RAD-MIB::agnIndication

description: The trap is sent whenever there is a transition from a no alarm
state to a state with at least one active alarm. An active alarm
state exists if:
1) The atmInterfaceActiveAlarms vector is different than 0.
2) The atmNteAlarmVpTable contains entries.
3) The atmNteAlarmVcTable contains entries.
The trap is also sent when a transition into the no alarm state
occurs.
The second variable will be atmInterfaceActiveAlarms to
indicate the kind of the alarm.
The trap is not sent more than once in a 10 second interval.

Summary.eval: ($v1==3) ? 'Alarm is active' : 'Alarm is inactive'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceAlarmTrap RAD-MIB::atmInterfaceAlarmStatus i 2

description: The variable is on(3) when there is any active alarm
on this interface.
variables.name: RAD-MIB::atmInterfaceAlarmStatus

description: The trap is sent every time a module is changed (Hot swapping).
The second variable will be atmNteCardType to indicate the
type of card that was inserted. The value empty(255) indicates that
a card was taken out.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceModuleChangeTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The trap is sent upon change in link as a result of redundancy.
The ifIndex parameter indicates the current active link.

event.Summary: Change in active link due to redundancy

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD RAD-ARC-MIB::atmAceRedundancyTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex
